summary: Navigator search for 'OpBuilder' returned zero hits; literal fallback scanned 64 files with missing trigram 'opb', highlighting search blind spots for short identifiers.
Opening a top hit is fast and returns a generous snippet (core/tests/suite/model_tools.rs:87) with surrounding context, validating symbol navigation flows.
Applying path_globs disables literal fallback entirely, so searching "Feature::ApplyPatchFreeform" under core/** returned zero hits despite matches elsewhere.
snippet requests against literal::* ids fail with 500 Internal Server Error, preventing quick context preview for literal hits.
open/snippet handlers always call symbol_with_contents, which in turn looks up the id in the symbol map and errors for literal::* hits; there is no fallback to read raw files.
literal fallback only considers queries with >=3 chars and is disabled whenever languages/categories/path_globs/file filters are present, so scoped searches lose literal assistance.

Priority fixes: (1) enable open/snippet for literal::* hits, (2) allow literal fallback under scoped filters by reusing file metadata filters, (3) remove 3-char guard so short identifiers still fall back, ideally using token candidates to limit scope.
